title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0197

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Katherine, and today we've got a great, informative lesson for you.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，今天我们为你准备了一堂很棒的信息丰富的课程。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We are going to talk about an emergency situation.
segments.cn: 我们将讨论紧急情况。

segments.en: So what do you do when you have an emergency?
segments.cn: 那么，当你遇到紧急情况时该怎么办？

segments.en: You dial 911.
segments.cn: 你拨打911。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正确。

segments.en: Alright, well maybe not in your country, but today we're talking about emergencies in America and jobs, so people who can help you in an emergency.
segments.cn: 好吧，也许在你们国家不是这样，但今天我们讨论的是美国的紧急情况和工作，所以可以在紧急情况下帮助你的人。

segments.en: So before we get into those words and phrases, let's take a listen to today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 在我们进入这些单词和短语之前，先来听一下今天的对话。

segments.en: Alright class, now that we're all dressed up, let's see what professions you chose.
segments.cn: 好吧，班级，现在我们都打扮好了，看看你们选择了什么职业。

segments.en: Ah, I see a fireman, a police officer, a medic, and a lifeguard.
segments.cn: 啊，我看到有一个消防员，一个警察，一个医务人员和一个救生员。

segments.en: Can anyone tell me what these people have in common?
segments.cn: 有人能告诉我这些人有什么共同点吗？

segments.en: They save people from bad things?
segments.cn: 他们拯救人们免受坏事？

segments.en: That's right!
segments.cn: 没错！

segments.en: Now class, if something bad happened and you had to get help, do you know what phone number you would call?
segments.cn: 现在班级，如果发生了坏事，你需要寻求帮助，你知道你会拨打哪个电话号码吗？

segments.en: Yes!
segments.cn: 是的！

segments.en: You would pick up the phone and dial 911.
segments.cn: 你会拿起电话拨打911。

segments.en: What are some emergency situations in which you would need to dial 911?
segments.cn: 你需要拨打911的紧急情况有哪些？

segments.en: If my grandpa had a heart attack.
segments.cn: 如果我爷爷心脏病发作。

segments.en: If there was an accident.
segments.cn: 如果发生了事故。

segments.en: If a robber broke into the house.
segments.cn: 如果有小偷闯入房子。

segments.en: If the fire alarm went off.
segments.cn: 如果火警警报响了。

segments.en: I wouldn't call 911 if the fire alarm went off in my house.
segments.cn: 如果我家里的火警响了，我不会拨打911。

segments.en: The only time that ever happens is when we're having spaghetti for supper and my mom burns the garlic bread as usual.
segments.cn: 这种情况只会发生在我们吃意大利面的时候，我妈妈像往常一样把蒜蓉面包烤糊了。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now we have a couple of different jobs for people that are working specifically in emergency situations.
segments.cn: 现在我们有几种不同的工作，专门在紧急情况下工作的人。

segments.en: So let's take a look at those now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们在语言收获中看看这些。

segments.en: Alright, so we have a teacher in today's dialogue who's talking to her students about jobs.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天的对话中有一位老师在和她的学生谈论工作。

segments.en: So probably these students are very young and she says another word that means jobs.
segments.cn: 所以这些学生可能很年轻，她说了另一个表示工作的词。

segments.en: What's the word she uses?
segments.cn: 她用的是什么词？

segments.en: Professions.
segments.cn: 职业。

segments.en: That's the plural.
segments.cn: 这是复数形式。

segments.en: So profession is a job.
segments.cn: 所以职业就是工作。

segments.en: Let's say for example a lawyer is a profession.
segments.cn: 比如说，律师就是一种职业。

segments.en: Or a doctor.
segments.cn: 或者医生。

segments.en: A doctor, a lawyer.
segments.cn: 医生，律师。

segments.en: So what's your profession is another way to ask what's your job.
segments.cn: 所以“你的职业是什么”是询问“你的工作是什么”的另一种方式。

segments.en: Alright, so they're talking about professions and some of the kids dressed up as different people.
segments.cn: 好吧，他们在谈论职业，一些孩子打扮成不同的人。

segments.en: The first one was a fireman.
segments.cn: 第一个是消防员。

segments.en: A fireman.
segments.cn: 消防员。

segments.en: So you know the first word fire.
segments.cn: 所以你知道第一个词是火。

segments.en: A fireman is a person who puts out a fire.
segments.cn: 消防员是扑灭火灾的人。

segments.en: That means he uses water to stop a fire.
segments.cn: 这意味着他用水来扑灭火。

segments.en: Oh, very good.
segments.cn: 哦，非常好。

segments.en: So a fireman puts out fires.
segments.cn: 所以消防员扑灭火灾。

segments.en: Now, apart from a fireman, we also have a police officer.
segments.cn: 现在，除了消防员，我们还有警察。

segments.en: A police officer.
segments.cn: 警察。

segments.en: So an officer is someone who works in an official capacity, so in a job.
segments.cn: 所以警官是以官方身份工作的人，也就是在工作中。

segments.en: So we could say he is a police officer or a policeman or a policewoman.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说他是警察或男警察或女警察。

segments.en: So three ways to say this.
segments.cn: 所以有三种说法。

segments.en: So officer is for both genders, right?
segments.cn: 所以警官适用于两性，对吧？

segments.en: A man or a woman could be a police officer.
segments.cn: 男性或女性都可以是警察。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you're going to hear this very often because policeman doesn't explain a woman police officer.
segments.cn: 所以你会经常听到这个，因为男警察并不能解释女警察。

segments.en: So we use police officer to be general.
segments.cn: 所以我们使用警察这个词来表示一般。

segments.en: Okay, so we have a fireman, a police officer, a medic.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有消防员、警察和医务人员。

segments.en: Now what is this medic?
segments.cn: 那么这个医务人员是什么？

segments.en: A medic is a kind of doctor.
segments.cn: 医务人员是一种医生。

segments.en: Someone who will look at your health or help you if hurt yourself, who usually works on the road like driving to an accident or driving to a fire with police officers.
segments.cn: 他们会关注你的健康或在你受伤时帮助你，通常在路上工作，比如开车去事故现场或与警察一起去火灾现场。

segments.en: So these people help police officers and firemen when there's an emergency.
segments.cn: 所以这些人在紧急情况下帮助警察和消防员。

segments.en: Okay, so a medic is not really a doctor.
segments.cn: 好吧，医务人员并不是真正的医生。

segments.en: He's more of a specific person that can help you if you have maybe some cuts or bruises or will help you out.
segments.cn: 他更像是一个特定的人，可以在你有一些割伤或淤伤时帮助你。

segments.en: Right, so this person will stop your bleeding or will help take you to the hospital, and they'll make sure that you're healthy when you get to the hospital.
segments.cn: 对，所以这个人会止住你的出血，或者会帮助你去医院，并确保你到达医院时是健康的。

segments.en: But they are not really like a doctor where you work in a hospital or a doctor's office.
segments.cn: 但他们并不是真正的医生，医生是在医院或诊所工作。

segments.en: Okay, and our last profession is a lifeguard.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们最后一个职业是救生员。

segments.en: Well, think about these two words.
segments.cn: 好吧，想想这两个词。

segments.en: We have life and we have guard.
segments.cn: 我们有生命和守护。

segments.en: Guard is like protect.
segments.cn: 守护就像保护。

segments.en: So a person that protects your life.
segments.cn: 所以一个保护你生命的人。

segments.en: Interesting.
segments.cn: 有趣。

segments.en: Well, this is someone who usually works at the beach or at a pool.
segments.cn: 好吧，这通常是一个在海滩或游泳池工作的人。

segments.en: They have a special chair and usually they have a cross on their bathing suit or on their towel.
segments.cn: 他们有一个特殊的椅子，通常他们的泳衣或毛巾上有一个十字架。

segments.en: And this means that they're going to help protect people who are at the beach.
segments.cn: 这意味着他们会帮助保护在海滩上的人。

segments.en: So if someone can't swim, the lifeguard will run or swim to get them and save them.
segments.cn: 所以如果有人不会游泳，救生员会跑或游过去救他们。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好吧，非常好。

segments.en: So you have a lifeguard.
segments.cn: 所以你有一个救生员。

segments.en: Now this is for men and women as well, right?
segments.cn: 这也是适用于男性和女性，对吧？

segments.en: A lifeguard.
segments.cn: 救生员。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正确。

segments.en: Okay, so interesting professions.
segments.cn: 好吧，有趣的职业。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue again?
segments.cn: 我们再听一次对话吧？

segments.en: And we'll be back shortly.
segments.cn: 我们很快就会回来。

segments.en: All right class, now that we're all dressed up, let's see what professions you chose.
segments.cn: 好吧，班级，现在我们都打扮好了，看看你们选择了什么职业。

segments.en: I see a fireman, a police officer, a medic, and a lifeguard.
segments.cn: 我看到有一个消防员，一个警察，一个医务人员和一个救生员。

segments.en: Can anyone tell me what these people have in common?
segments.cn: 有人能告诉我这些人有什么共同点吗？

segments.en: They save people from bad things.
segments.cn: 他们拯救人们免受坏事。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Now class, if something bad happened and you had to get help, do you know what phone number you would call?
segments.cn: 现在班级，如果发生了坏事，你需要寻求帮助，你知道你会拨打哪个电话号码吗？

segments.en: Yes, you would pick up the phone and dial 911.
segments.cn: 是的，你会拿起电话拨打911。

segments.en: What are some emergency situations in which you would need to dial 911?
segments.cn: 你需要拨打911的紧急情况有哪些？

segments.en: If my grandpa had a heart attack.
segments.cn: 如果我爷爷心脏病发作。

segments.en: If there was an accident.
segments.cn: 如果发生了事故。

segments.en: If a robber broke into the house.
segments.cn: 如果有小偷闯入房子。

segments.en: If the fire alarm went off.
segments.cn: 如果火警警报响了。

segments.en: I wouldn't call 911 if the fire alarm went off in my house.
segments.cn: 如果我家里的火警响了，我不会拨打911。

segments.en: The only time that ever happens is when we're having spaghetti for supper and my mom burns the garlic bread as usual.
segments.cn: 这种情况只会发生在我们吃意大利面的时候，我妈妈像往常一样把蒜蓉面包烤糊了。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's start with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们开始流利度训练。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利度训练。

segments.en: Our first item in Fluency Builder we've already talked about.
segments.cn: 我们在流利度训练中讨论过的第一项。

segments.en: The number in America to call when you have an emergency is 911.
segments.cn: 在美国，遇到紧急情况时拨打的号码是911。

segments.en: So we usually say, hey, dial 911.
segments.cn: 所以我们通常说，嘿，拨打911。

segments.en: Okay, so that's a verb there.
segments.cn: 好的，这里是一个动词。

segments.en: To dial.
segments.cn: 拨打。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: To dial means to select the numbers for a phone call.
segments.cn: 拨打意味着选择拨打电话的号码。

segments.en: To telephone someone.
segments.cn: 给某人打电话。

segments.en: To telephone someone.
segments.cn: 给某人打电话。

segments.en: To dial.
segments.cn: 拨打。

segments.en: So you can dial 911 or dial my office number.
segments.cn: 所以你可以拨打911或拨打我的办公室号码。

segments.en: Or I tried to dial your home number, but no one answered.
segments.cn: 或者我试图拨打你的家庭号码，但没有人接听。

segments.en: Okay, now you can call 911 for many different situations or emergency.
segments.cn: 好的，现在你可以在许多不同的情况下拨打911或紧急电话。

segments.en: One of the kids said, well, if my grandpa had a heart attack.
segments.cn: 有个孩子说，如果我爷爷心脏病发作。

segments.en: Okay, so this is an example of an emergency.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是一个紧急情况的例子。

segments.en: A heart attack is a medical problem.
segments.cn: 心脏病发作是一种医疗问题。

segments.en: It's when your heart cannot receive oxygen.
segments.cn: 这是当你的心脏无法接收氧气时。

segments.en: Okay, so your heart stops beating sometimes.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你的心脏有时会停止跳动。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Sorry.
segments.cn: 对不起。

segments.en: It's when your heart does not receive enough blood or oxygen.
segments.cn: 这是当你的心脏没有接收到足够的血液或氧气时。

segments.en: So it's when your heart stops beating.
segments.cn: 所以这是当你的心脏停止跳动。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So that's a heart attack.
segments.cn: 所以这就是心脏病发作。

segments.en: Now another possible emergency situation is if the fire alarm goes off.
segments.cn: 现在另一个可能的紧急情况是如果火警警报响了。

segments.en: This often happens in office buildings and schools.
segments.cn: 这通常发生在办公楼和学校。

segments.en: So you hear a...
segments.cn: 所以你听到一个...

segments.en: Some kind of strange noise.
segments.cn: 某种奇怪的声音。

segments.en: Well, that's because there's maybe a fire or some smoke in your building.
segments.cn: 嗯，那是因为你的建筑里可能有火或烟。

segments.en: And so usually when this sound goes off, it automatically calls the police and the fire department.
segments.cn: 所以通常当这个声音响起时，它会自动拨打警察和消防部门。

segments.en: Okay, now there's an interesting phrasal verb that is used along with this word fire alarm.
segments.cn: 好的，现在有一个有趣的短语动词与这个火警警报一起使用。

segments.en: We say the fire alarm goes off or the fire alarm went off.
segments.cn: 我们说火警警报响了或火警警报响起了。

segments.en: So that means it started to sound, to emit a sound.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着它开始发出声音。

segments.en: So the verb here, as you said, it's a phrasal verb is to go off, to go off.
segments.cn: 所以这里的动词，正如你所说，是一个短语动词，意思是响起，响起。

segments.en: We could say my alarm went off or every morning at seven o'clock my alarm goes off.
segments.cn: 我们可以说我的警报响了，或者每天早上七点我的警报响起。

segments.en: Okay, that means your alarm begins to make a sound.
segments.cn: 好的，这意味着你的警报开始发出声音。

segments.en: A very annoying sound.
segments.cn: 一个非常恼人的声音。

segments.en: You know, it's the worst sound ever.
segments.cn: 你知道，这是最糟糕的声音。

segments.en: But a lot of things can go off.
segments.cn: 但是很多东西都可以响起。

segments.en: We could talk about a bell or an alarm or fireworks.
segments.cn: 我们可以谈论铃声、警报或烟花。

segments.en: Fireworks go off.
segments.cn: 烟花响起。

segments.en: Okay, and well, the last emergency that we were talking about is if a robber broke into the house.
segments.cn: 好的，最后我们谈论的紧急情况是如果一个抢劫犯闯入房子。

segments.en: If a robber breaks in.
segments.cn: 如果一个抢劫犯闯入。

segments.en: To break into.
segments.cn: 闯入。

segments.en: This means to enter, to go inside without permission or without a key.
segments.cn: 这意味着在没有许可或没有钥匙的情况下进入。

segments.en: Illegally.
segments.cn: 非法。

segments.en: Illegally.
segments.cn: 非法。

segments.en: So you don't have to break something, but usually you break a window or a door.
segments.cn: 所以你不必打破什么，但通常你会打破窗户或门。

segments.en: But this means that someone comes into your house looking to steal something.
segments.cn: 但这意味着有人进入你的房子想要偷东西。

segments.en: So usually you have to use force.
segments.cn: 所以通常你必须使用暴力。

segments.en: For example, if I forget my keys inside my car and I have to break into my own car, that means maybe I have to force the door open or maybe break the window.
segments.cn: 例如，如果我把钥匙忘在车里，我必须闯入自己的车，这意味着我可能必须强行打开车门或打破窗户。

segments.en: Yeah, it's not, not fun.
segments.cn: 是的，这并不好玩。

segments.en: I think it usually ends up being very expensive.
segments.cn: 我认为这通常会变得非常昂贵。

segments.en: Yes, it does.
segments.cn: 是的，确实如此。

segments.en: All right, so those are all the phrases we have for today.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们今天所有的短语。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue for the very last time?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不最后一次听我们的对话呢？

segments.en: All right class, now that we're all dressed up, let's see what professions you chose.
segments.cn: 好的，班级，现在我们都打扮好了，让我们看看你们选择了什么职业。

segments.en: Ah, I see a fireman, a police officer, a medic, and a lifeguard.
segments.cn: 啊，我看到一个消防员，一个警察，一个医务人员和一个救生员。

segments.en: Can anyone tell me what these people have in common?
segments.cn: 有人能告诉我这些人有什么共同点吗？

segments.en: They save people from bad things?
segments.cn: 他们拯救人们免受坏事？

segments.en: That's right!
segments.cn: 没错！

segments.en: Now class, if something bad happened and you had to get help, do you know what phone number you would call?
segments.cn: 现在班级，如果发生了坏事，你需要寻求帮助，你知道你会拨打哪个电话号码吗？

segments.en: Yes, you would pick up the phone and dial 911.
segments.cn: 是的，你会拿起电话拨打911。

segments.en: What are some emergency situations in which you would need to dial 911?
segments.cn: 在什么紧急情况下你需要拨打911？

segments.en: If my grandpa had a heart attack.
segments.cn: 如果我爷爷心脏病发作。

segments.en: If there was an accident.
segments.cn: 如果发生了事故。

segments.en: If a robber broke into the house.
segments.cn: 如果一个抢劫犯闯入房子。

segments.en: If the fire alarm went off.
segments.cn: 如果火警警报响了。

segments.en: I wouldn't call 911 if the fire alarm went off in my house.
segments.cn: 如果我家里的火警警报响了，我不会拨打911。

segments.en: The only time that ever happens is when we're having spaghetti for supper and my mom burns the garlic bread as usual.
segments.cn: 这种情况只会发生在我们吃意大利面时，我妈妈像往常一样把蒜蓉面包烤糊了。

segments.en: So Marco, when you were a kid and your teacher said, what jobs are there?
segments.cn: 所以马尔科，当你还是个孩子时，你的老师问，什么工作有？

segments.en: What professions are there?
segments.cn: 有什么职业？

segments.en: What profession would you like?
segments.cn: 你想要什么职业？

segments.en: What did you answer?
segments.cn: 你怎么回答的？

segments.en: I always wanted to be a pilot.
segments.cn: 我一直想成为一名飞行员。

segments.en: Oh, pilots.
segments.cn: 哦，飞行员。

segments.en: You wanted to fly airplanes.
segments.cn: 你想驾驶飞机。

segments.en: Yeah, I wanted to be a jet pilot.
segments.cn: 是的，我想成为一名喷气式飞行员。

segments.en: Actually, I collected books about it.
segments.cn: 实际上，我收集过关于它的书。

segments.en: I read up about it.
segments.cn: 我读过关于它的资料。

segments.en: Even till now, I probably still remember the capacity of certain jets or what types of weapons they have.
segments.cn: 直到现在，我可能仍然记得某些喷气机的容量或它们有什么类型的武器。

segments.en: I was really, really into it.
segments.cn: 我真的非常喜欢它。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: I never knew this about you.
segments.cn: 我从来不知道你这一点。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: What about you?
segments.cn: 你呢？

segments.en: I could never decide as a kid.
segments.cn: 我小时候从来无法决定。

segments.en: I remember we had to draw pictures of what I will look like in 20 years.
segments.cn: 我记得我们必须画出20年后我会是什么样子。

segments.en: And everyone had these pictures.
segments.cn: 每个人都有这些画。

segments.en: I will be a doctor, I'll be a veterinarian, I'll be the president.
segments.cn: 我会成为医生，我会成为兽医，我会成为总统。

segments.en: I never knew what to draw.
segments.cn: 我从来不知道该画什么。

segments.en: So, you know, I think I copied my friend.
segments.cn: 所以，你知道，我想我抄了我朋友的。

segments.en: She wanted to be a lawyer.
segments.cn: 她想成为律师。

segments.en: Okay, that sounds okay.
segments.cn: 好吧，听起来不错。

segments.en: Yeah, I think it's hard.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得这很难。

segments.en: And usually what you want to be as a kid, you don't do it when you're older.
segments.cn: 通常你小时候想成为的职业，长大后并不会去做。

segments.en: I couldn't do it because of my vision.
segments.cn: 我不能做到，因为我的视力。

segments.en: I didn't have 20-20 vision to actually join the Air Force.
segments.cn: 我没有20/20的视力，无法加入空军。

segments.en: Well, and a lot of kids don't know how many jobs there are out there.
segments.cn: 好吧，很多孩子不知道外面有多少工作。

segments.en: You know the big ones.
segments.cn: 你知道那些大职业。

segments.en: Doctor, lawyer, fireman, policeman, astronaut.
segments.cn: 医生、律师、消防员、警察、宇航员。

segments.en: So I guess the question for you is what's your profession?
segments.cn: 所以我想问你，你的职业是什么？

segments.en: Tell us about it, especially if it's one of the less famous professions out there, because there's a lot that I don't know about those.
segments.cn: 告诉我们，特别是如果它是那些不太知名的职业，因为我对那些了解不多。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: We hope to see you there.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那里见到你。

segments.en: And until next time, bye.
segments.cn: 下次再见，拜。
